GoT is in a funny artistic position bc when it tries to be artistically coherent, it stops working. the whole point of it is that it's got all these mythic aesthetics, stuff that primes you to think of "how stories go" & then it turns out it's dispassionate medieval history
but that's the whole point. in any good zombie movie, it's always the infighting and human flaws that really kill people.

season 1 of game of thrones feels like it shares principles with zombie movies, just...diffusely so. instead of being trapped in a bunker or a mall, the characters are trapped inside the whole world. they've forgotten they're in a zombie movie.

Companies have been giving away shopping coupons for decades that are redeemable without requiring the identity of the person presenting the coupon. By this twisted logic, every coupon redeem should require government ID. It's clearly total made up nonsense.

This is simply not true. Anyone can buy a Monopoly set or use a database without having to identify themselves, and "tokens" are no exception. The word "value" here is meaningless. When companies give away free goods or services, they are "valuable" and don't require an identity.
